A research scientist attempts to understand the influence of carbon dioxide content in blood on its oxygen binding. The scientist adds carbon dioxide to dog blood and measures the uptake of oxygen in the blood versus oxygen pressure in the peripheral tissue. options.label: A
options.text: Binding of O2 to hemoglobin in lungs drives release of CO2 from haemoglobin

options.label: B
options.text: The sum of the partial pressures of CO2 and O2 cannot exceed a known threshold in blood

options.label: C
options.text: High partial pressure of CO2 in tissues facilitates O2 unloading in peripheral tissues

options.text: High partial pressure of CO2 in tissues causes alkalemia, which is necessary for O2 unloading

questions.correct_answer: C. High partial pressure of CO2 in tissues facilitates O2 unloading in peripheral tissues

options.label: D

questions.text: Which of the following has a lower concentration in the CSF as compared to cerebral capillary blood?
All of the following are true about short chain fatty acids except-

options.label: A
options.text: SCFAs are produced in colon by the action of colonic bacteria on complex carbohydrates, resistant starches and dietary fiber

options.label: C
options.text: SCFAs are absorbed in the colon

options.label: D
options.text: SCFAs are absorbed by Na-SCFA co transport

questions.correct_answer: D. SCFAs are absorbed by Na-SCFA co transport

questions.text: RQ of a person exclusively on carbohydrate diet is-

Output of the motor cortex is from which layer?
In the histology section given below, which area is involved in pain relief due to massage therapy?

True about Ondine’s curse is-

options.label: A
options.text: Automated control of respiration is intact

options.label: B
options.text: Voluntary control of respiration is disrupted

questions.correct_answer: B. Voluntary control of respiration is disrupted
